arm_group.description: Injection of 40 ml of Marcaine ½ % 2 cm medial, 2 cm downwards from the Anterior Iliac Spine
Needle prick 2 cm medial and 2 cm downwards from the Anterior Iliac spine

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is undertaken to clarify whether intraoperative blockage with 40 ml of ½ %
      Marcaine© of the nerves in the ilio-inguinal canal may decrease postoperative pain after
      laparoscopic inguinal hernia repair.

      Patients will be randomised to injection of Marcaine© og a needle prick per-operatively.

      Pain will be estimated using the VAS score in:

      1. the wound 2  the abdomen 3  the shoulder

      Scoring will be performed:

        1. pre-operatively

        2. 1 hour postoperatively

        3. at discharge from the hospital d  day 1,2 and 3 post OP

      e. 1 year post OP

clinical_study.brief_title: Ilioinguinal Block in Laparoscopic Inguinal Hernia Repair
clinical_study.condition: Post Operative Pain as Estimated by the Sue of the VAS Score

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Age ≥ 18 year

          2. Informed consent

          3. a diagnosis of an inguinal hernia

          4. ASA group ≤ 3

          5. BMI ≤ 35

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Communication problems

          2. No consent

          3. Open procedure (not laparoscopic)

          4. ASA-group 4

          5. Use of Steroid or immunosuppressive tretament

          6. Regular morphine use.
